column4: I am in the middle of upgrading from Ubuntu 9.10 to 10.04 LTS.  It presented me with a prompt "Replace the customized configuration file /etc/sysctl.conf?" but my USB mouse and keyboard aren't responding!  I've tried another USB mouse and keyboard (on various USB ports), and even dug up an old PS/2 mouse.  Is there a way to reset the mouse without resetting the computer?  I tried modprobe -r usb_storage but that module is in use.  Sug
p.s.  I have remote commandline access to the machine
sounds like you added to the file, not sure about the keyboard / mouse stopping. If you unplug then plug them back in is it better?

I tried unplugging but that didn't work.  I honestly don't care about my changes to the configuration file, I just want the upgrade to continue without restarting the computer in the middle (which I assume might brick it).
